p: In the general case model, the SST bias in any coupled model at any location depends on the sum of the local atmospheric model component F biases and ocean model component C biases, divided by the sum of the sensitivities of the coupled F and C responses to local SST (Eq. 3). The strong ∆T on ∆F A correlation of 0.84 (R2) and supporting theory, strongly suggest that for 40–60°S variations across the AMIP5 model net flux biases are the dominant control on the variations in CMIP5 model SST biases. Seventy percent ( r 2 = 0.70) of the CMIP5 ∆T variance is found to be explained by AMIP5 ∆F A. If, as we expect, ∆F A and ∆C O are independent then stand-alone ocean-ice model bias variations ( ∆C O) cannot explain more than ~30% of ∆T variance (for details see Methods).
